title: Maria de los Ángeles Benavides Guaca
text:
I am a biology undergraduate student interested in the epigenetic and physiological mechanisms of different organisms, and I am also very curious about the processes of embryological development.


 Back to top

title: Juan Camilo Arboleda Rivera
text: I am a biologist currently working in the Grupo de Fundamentos y Enseñanza de la Física y los Sistemas Dinámicos and the Grupo de Biología Computacional at the University of Antioquia (UdeA), Colombia. I work as professor of the course of Genetics in the Institute of Biology at the UdeA.

title: Juan Camilo Arboleda Rivera
text:
Interests
I am mainly interested in fields as Computational Biology, Systems Biology, Molecular Biology, Genetics and Bioinformatics. I am also an enthusiast of Linux and FOSS and would like to learn more about programming and its applications to biology.

title: Jose Miguel Tobón García
text:
My name is José Miguel Tobón and I am an undergraduate student at the Institute of Biology of the University of Antioquia. My passion for fish has been a constant in my life, which has sparked a special interest in these organisms. Recently, I have ventured into the world of programming, seeking to integrate it harmoniously with my work as a biologist.
Currently, I am immersed in a machine learning project, where I am acquiring experience and knowledge in this area. My long-term goal is to merge ecology with the potential of programming, seeking to contribute to the development of innovative solutions in this field.


 Back to top

title: Gloria Machado Rodríguez
text: Back to top

title: Daniela Sánchez Aristizábal
text:
Hi! I am Daniela Sánchez, I am currently studying Biology at the University of Antioquia. I am very passionate about molecular biology and the use of computational tools to understand molecular phenomena draws my attention.
My interests focus on the regulation of gene expression, dynamical systems biology and applications of Machine Learning in the analysis of omics data. Outside of academics, I enjoy spending time in nature, especially the river, and spending time with my pets. Additionally, I like to practice Pilates and I really enjoy the art of crochet.
Observing and understanding biological and natural phenomena is one of my greatest passions, which is why science has become an important part of my life.


 Back to top

title: Emmanuel Ortega Atehortúa
text:
I am a biologist and currently work in the Fundamentals and Teaching of Physics and Dynamic Systems Group and the Computational Biology Group at the University of Antioquia (UdeA), Colombia.
I am mainly interested in areas such as Theoretical Biology, Mathematical Biology, Computational Biology and Systems Biology. Within biology my main areas are virology and evolution.


 Back to top

title: Courses and workshops
text:
As part of the effort to promote Computational Biology and Free Software, our group develops courses and workshops in which we teach different tools that are very useful not only in science but in the digital world in general. Below you will find a list of tools that we use in our group and that we can teach you.

Linux
Git/GitHub
Python
C++
Bash (Linux is prerequisite)
R
LaTeX
Vim (Linux is prerequisite)
Systems Biology

Mathematical modelling
Graph theory

Bioinformatics (Linux is prerequisite)

FastQC
Trimmomatic
Genome assembly
Metagenomics
Gene expression analysis

Data analysis in Pandas (basic Python is prerequisite)
Make (Linux is prerequisite)
Dynamical systems
Machine Learning
SQL databases
Molecular dynamics (Linux is prerequisite)
Robotics with Arduino
GUI development with Qt (C++ is prerequisite)
Markdown

If you want to learn about any of these topics, do not hesitate to write to us and express your interest. We also suggest you fill out the following form to find out what your interests are:

Cargando…




 Back to top

title: Computational Biology Research Group
text: The Computational Biology Research Group is part of the Institute of Biology at the University of Antioquia in Medellín, Colombia and its goal is to understand diverse biological phenomena by using computational tools, in addition to promote the field of computational biology in Colombia.

title: Computational Biology Research Group
text:
Contact information
 Juan Camilo Arboleda Rivera
 juan.arboleda2@udea.edu.co

title: Journal Club
text:
We invite you to participate in our Journal Club where we discuss the latest research and advances in science.
Hour: Wednesday, usually 12:00 to 13:00, occasionally 13:00 to 14:00.
Location: Room 7-305, Institute of Biology, University of Antioquia
The following is the Journal Club schedule for 2024:

text:

Autosomal factors implicated in X Chromosome Inactivation.
Representation of DNA for Machine Learning applications.
Self-targeting spacers and new functions of CRISPR systems.

title: Ana María López Pérez
text:
I am a biology student with a particular interest in viral diversity and viral and bacterial infection mechanisms. My fascination with understanding the interaction between viruses and their hosts leads me to explore computational biology as a tool to analyze large genomic data sets and better understand the evolution and dynamics of viral infections.
On the other hand, I also have a great passion for plants, which motivates me to delve deeper into plant diversity, plant genomics and everything related to their secondary metabolites.
I am excited to combine my interest in biology with the power of computing to address complex biological questions and contribute to the advancement of knowledge in these interdisciplinary fields.


 Back to top

title: David Salomón Bonilla Cárdenas
text:
I am an undergraduate biology student at the University of Antioquia. I am passionate about biology and my areas of greatest interest are molecular biology, immunology and neurosciences.
I like to know and explore nature, scientific communication, dance and martial arts.

title: Miguel Ángel Tangarife Cardona
text: I am a student of biology, I am part of the Computational Biology Group and the Agricultural and Environmental Bacteriology (BA&A) group at the University of Antioquia (UdeA), Colombia.

title: Miguel Ángel Tangarife Cardona
text:
Interests
My interests lie in the field of agricultural microbiology, bioinformatics, and molecular biology. I love working in biotechnology, lover of bacteriophages, bacteria, dancing and coffee.
